alert.note: Alert for Carroll; Coos; Grafton (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued December 18 at 1:12PM EST until December 18 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: The National Weather Service in Gray has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Carroll County in northern New Hampshire... Southeastern Coos County in northern New Hampshire... Eastern Grafton County in northern New Hampshire... * Until 700 PM EST. * At 112 PM EST, local law enforcement reported heavy rain and flooding across the warned area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rain and snowmelt. SOURCE...Law enforcement reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Conway, Bethlehem, Lincoln, Moultonborough, Ossipee, Plymouth, Holderness, Ashland, Effingham and Franconia. This includes Interstate 93 between mile markers 75 and 114. This includes the following Rec locations... Crawford Notch State Park, Franconia Notch, Mount Moosilauke, Rumney Rocks, Cannon Mountain, North Twin Mountain, Franconia Ridge, Mount Jefferson, Mount Madison, Mount Eisenhower, Mount Chocorua, Wildcat Mountain, Carter Notch, Kearsarge North , Mount Lafayette, Mount Garfield, Mount Adams, Mount Isolation, AMC Highland Center, Mount Webster, Mount Whiteface, Mount Moriah, AMC Greenleaf Hut, AMC Lonesome Lake Hut, AMC Galehead Hut, AMC Zealand Falls Hut, AMC Mizpah Spring Hut, AMC Lake of the Clouds Hut, AMC Madison Spring Hut, AMC Carter Notch Hut, Carr Mountain, Stinson Mountain, Long Pond Recreation Area, Elbow Pond Recreation Area, South Kinsman Mountain, Mount Flume, Mount Liberty, South Twin Mountain, Mount Bond, Mount Carrigan, Mount Willey, Mount Tom, Mount Field, Mount Jackson, Arethusa Falls, Ripley Falls, Mount Osceola, Mount Tecumseh, Welch Mountain, Dickey Mountain, The Tripyramids, Mount Passaconaway, Greeley Ponds, Sabbaday Falls, Champney Falls, Rocky Gorge Scenic Area, Lower Falls Recreation Area, North Baldface, South Baldface, Mount Doublehead, West Royce Mountain and Mountain Pond. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
